title: Why does Lux's E cost 130 mana?

replies.body: Do you know how much photon pressure it takes to deflect moving matter?
{{champion:99}} Touché, summoner.
Because pre-nerf Chalice.
Because Athene's used to give her almost unlimited mana, and a 130 mana cost was reasonable back then.

Why can cass spam e on minion waves and STILL GAIN MANA BACK
Meanwhile lux cant clear waves. Has to spend 130 mana and auto everything once or 3x on melee minions to even clear
Wait what? Since when can't she clear waves? I never had problems doing it with E and hitting the 1 or 2 minions left.

Since season 5. In season 4 you could clear the caster creeps with grail and deathcap, which meant you could do it 1 or 2 levels later than other wave clear mids. Not unreasonable. If you fell behind though, you wouldn't do it until much much later. When minions got MR removed and a health buff in season 5, and now with another slight health buff in patch 5.5, Lux's "just barely" wave clear turned into no wave clear at all. Now even with deathcap you can't clear even the back line. Not a single creep. 

E just does poor damage compared to other wave clear abilities even though it has the highest mana cost out of any of them and the highest cooldown. 10 sec cd, 130 mana, 240 base dmg and 60% ap scaling. Ziggs, Xerath, Syndra, Orianna all have cheaper, lower cooldown, higher damaging waveclear. Check the numbers for yourself.

While I don't agree on the mana cost, I unlike everyone else have yet to have waveclear problems with Lux.

Maybe it is because I max E first instead of Q or W like most Lux players.

Because long range, high AOE dmg, utility skill. Just like Ori W. It needs to have some downsides.

Except it's not as good as Orianna W. Orianna W has a lower cooldown, lower mana cost, bigger slow, higher base damage, higher ap scaling, also gives vision through her ball, and in addition gives allies movement speed too. The slow field is left behind after the damage so you can have both, whereas once you detonate Lux E for the damage you give up the slow. 

And even if Orianna's W didn't already waveclear on its own due to the higher base damage and ap scaling, Ori can throw her ball around and wave clear that way. Lux has no other wave clear abilities, her E doesn't even clear the casters, and it is on a 10 second cooldown. So she basically doesn't wave clear at this point.

Orianna W- need to be near ball, to reposition ball pay at least 50 mana. To use W pay 70+ (dependent on rank). In total, 120 mana minimum and a fairly long basic skill cd. If she can W you, you are long dead. The ball is death, dodge the ball.

Lux E- same mana cost (by the time its all said and done) roughly, is a single less telegraphed cast, does significantly less damage and has vastly less utility. Unlike Orianna and Ball, getting hit by E is garbage. Sure, a brief slow and its got a small aoe zone. Damage is mediocre: 240 base with 60% ratio, for real?

Tl;DR: Bad comparison and I totally agree to reduce the mana cost. That or raise the base damage (not scaling). For 130 mana, I can blitz grab/punch you.

Lux is an obvious victim of the Athene nerfs, perhaps moreso than any other champion. She's balanced around having an item that makes her mana regen insane, which it no longer does.
